When we decided to use JUnit for the first time (more than an year 
ago) we decided so because of the following 4 factors.

- It can automate stuff (you dont have to write lots of scripts and 
code for that - we did automate our tests)
- It is extensible (you can control its behaviour as per your needs - 
we did extend it to suit our needs)
- It is written by people who know what would be the best framework
- It is easy to use once understood
- It is free



--- In junit@y..., venkatesh srinivasan <venky_gct@y...> wrote:
> Hi Folks
> I am having a basic question..!
> Why should i go for JUnit testing Framework which i
> can accompolish in plain java class.?
> See what ever i am writing inside a test case funtion
> , i can write it in a plain java class which doesn't
> extend TestCase class?
> 
> For example if i want to write a testcase for an EJB i
> have to write a lookup initialisation function in 
> setUp() method....and write a test case function for
> each test behaviour...right?
> This i can accomoplish using plain java class which
> can execute different user defined function!!!!
> 
> Now if anyone you can tell a solid reason/scenario for
> which i have to use JUnit test framework, i will be
> very much thankful...and most of the beginners can
> have a clear understanding...........
> 
> Thanx and Regards, 
> Venky
>
